unnormalised: ## Going Viral: Kya Hai Yeh Chakkar, Boss?
normalised: ## Going Viral: What is This Thing, Boss?

unnormalised: Hey everyone, Sharmaji here, back with another dose of social media masala! Today, we're diving deep into the wild world of virality. You know, that sweet, sweet moment when your content explodes faster than a Diwali cracker. But how do you actually *make* something go viral? It's less about luck and more about understanding the current trends, bhai.
normalised: Hey everyone, Sharmaji here, back with another dose of social media masala! Today, we are diving deep into the wild world of virality. You know, that sweet, sweet moment when your content explodes faster than a Diwali cracker. But how do you actually *make* something go viral? It is less about luck and more about understanding the current trends, bhai.

unnormalised: First off, let's talk about trends. What's making people go "wah!" right now? Short-form video is KING. Think reels, TikToks, YouTube Shorts – bite-sized content that grabs attention instantly. Remember that "Rasode Mein Kaun Tha?" rap from 2020? Pure gold. Find your own "Rasode Mein Kaun Tha?", something relatable and catchy.

unnormalised: Then there's the challenge trend. Remember the Ice Bucket Challenge? Or that "Jalebi Baby" dance craze? Find a way to tap into that competitive spirit. Maybe a #DosaFlippingChallenge? Just throwing ideas out there! But keep it safe, ya! We don't want anyone ending up in a hospital like AIIMS on 26/01/2023, right?

unnormalised: Humor is always a winner. Indians love a good laugh. Think about those hilarious aunties on Instagram recreating Bollywood scenes. Authenticity is key, though. Don't try to be someone you're not. People in Delhi, Mumbai, Bangalore - they can smell fake from a km away!

unnormalised: Also, keep an eye on what's trending on Twitter. Use relevant hashtags, but don't just stuff them in blindly. Make sure they actually fit your content.

unnormalised: And don't forget the power of collaboration! Partner with other creators, especially those with a similar audience. Imagine a collaboration between Bhuvan Bam and Prajakta Koli! Boom! Viral alert!

unnormalised: One last tip: timing is everything. Post at the right time, when your audience is most active. For example, a lot of people check social media during their lunch break around 13:00 hrs or after office hours at 18:00 hrs. Experiment and see what works best for you.
